jrigby.openstack_queue.server

Class ServerCollection

  • java.lang.Object
    • jrigby.openstack_queue.server.ServerCollection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, Iterable<org.jclouds.openstack.nova.v2_0.domain.Server>, Collection<org.jclouds.openstack.nova.v2_0.domain.Server>, Set<org.jclouds.openstack.nova.v2_0.domain.Server>

    public class ServerCollection
extends Object
implements Set<org.jclouds.openstack.nova.v2_0.domain.Server>, Closeable
    A set of servers that have been dedicated to a particular ResourceRequest. It is backed by an ImmutableSet and therefore cannot be modified after it is created.
    Author:
    jason

    • Constructor Detail

      • ServerCollection

        public ServerCollection(OSConnection connection,
                String defaultLoginUser,
                org.jclouds.openstack.nova.v2_0.domain.KeyPair keyPair,
                String logPath,
                org.jclouds.openstack.nova.v2_0.domain.Server... servers)
        Creates a ServerCollection backed by an ImmutableSet, which cannot be modified after its creation. This constructor also performs some server customisation before they are made available for use.
        Parameters:
        connection - the OSConnection from which these servers were created
        defaultLoginUser - the default login user for SSH connections to these servers
        keyPair - the SSH key pair injected when these servers were created
        logPath - the path in which to store the server log files
        servers - an array of server objects

      • requireOpenState

        private void requireOpenState()
        Throws an IllegalStateException if the ServerCollection is closed. Used in all methods where all nodes are expected to be active. IllegalStateException is a runtime exception that is generally caught in implementations of ResourceProvisioningCallback such as ThreeStageJobCallback.
